sub_title: Designing Airports for the Future | Airport Consultant at NACO
summary:
I am an airport civil engineer specialized in the design of the airside infrastructure. My focus is on delivering a future-proof design that enables airport's operational success today and is flexible to accomodate its future infrastructural needs. To achieve this, I put the close coordination with the airport operator and stakeholders at the heart of each project.

In addition, I get highly motivated from the multi-disciplinary engineering and architectural challenges that an airport development project brings, and solving them within the dynamic and enthusiastic team of NACO.  

I have experience in various type and size of projects, just to mention a few:
- Expansion of Mega HUB airports like London Heathrow in UK;  the current busiest airport of Europe,
- Greenfield airports like Mexico New International Airport, which had a construction budget of $13.3 Billion (US Dollars),
- Rehabilitation and expansion of point-to-point airports like Kukës Airport and Tirana International Airport in Albania. 

My expertise has delivered solutions in different phases of the airport infrastructure project: 
- from concept design to detail design, 
- preparation of tender documents for construction, 
- technical evaluation of bidders’ offers, 
- construction support. 

On top of standard airport projects, I am enthusiastic about innovative projects that might transform the future of aviation. Therefore, I am working on the development of the Circular Runway, and the Vertically Curved Runway. 

Besides my aviation knowledge, I have research experience on structural engineering in The Czech Republic, and I assisted several geotechnical consultancy works in Spain.

profile_positions.description:
• About my role: Assistant Project Manager of a multidisciplinary team, including Terminal Building, Public Transport Interchange, Airside, Landside, Security, IT & Special Airport Systems.

• About the project: The Solidarity Transport Hub is a megaproject of the Government of Poland aimed at the construction of a new airport, which will integrate air, rail, and road transport. During the first stage, the airport will handle 40 Million Annual Passenger.

NACO has been invited by Foster+Partners to join expertise for the design of the Terminal Building and the Public Transport Interchange (rail & road)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Manager for the Solidarity Transport HUB of Poland

profile_positions.description:
• About my role: Responsible for the airside civil design of a variety of airports that range from large HUB airports like the expansion of London Heathrow (UK) to point-to-point airports like the rehabilitation of Kukës (Albania); just to mention a couple of them. On top of standard airport projects, I am enthusiastic about innovative projects that might transform the future of aviation. Therefore, I am working on the development of the Circular Runway, and the Vertically Curved Runway.

• About our designs: They are pragmatic for the success of the operations of the airport, and flexible for the future developments of the infrastructure.
profile_positions.title: Airport Consultant | Airside Civil Engineer

profile_positions.location: London, United Kingdom; The Hague, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
London Heathrow West expansion, UK.

• About my role: Assistant project manager of a multidisciplinary team, including, but not limited to: aviation, environmental, rivers, rail, roads, energy, utilities and BIM.

•About the project: Heathrow airport is planning to increase the passenger capacity from 85.5 million to 130 million per year. Royal HaskoningDHV has been invited by Arora to join the design working team for the conceptual design of the western HUB.

The main technical challenge of this project is the limited area available for the expansion which requires the rerouting of the busiest highway of UK (M25), a river diversion and maximizing the vertical design of the airside/landside in order to decrease the area required. In addition, minimizing the environmental impact plays a key role during the design phase.

 More information: https://heathrow.thearoragroup.com/
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Manager for the expansion of Heathrow Airport, based in London and The Hague

profile_positions.description:
Mexico City New International Airport (NAIM):

• About my role: Airside design coordinator based in Mexico City during design, tender and construction phases. The multidisciplinary airside team consists of geotechnical, structural, drainage, civil, Aeronautical Ground Lighting (AGL), Navigational Aids (NAVAIDs) and BIM.

• About the project: The New International Airport has a design capacity of 120 million passengers per year. NACO is part of the joint venture TASANA who is responsible for the airside and landside designs of the first construction phase of the project. This phase has a budget of $13.3 Billion (US Dollars) which consists of, but not limited to: 3 code F runways; 1 Terminal building; commercial, cargo, maintenance, military and general aviation aprons; Heliport; 1 air traffic control tower; other buildings and services.

This greenfield airport has very exciting technical design challenges since it is built in the Texcoco lake: a location renowned for its soft soil characteristics and frequent flooding.
profile_positions.title: Airside design coordinator/ Airport civil engineer

company.name: Institute of Structural Mechanics at VUT Brno, Czech Republic.

profile_positions.company: Institute of Structural Mechanics at VUT Brno, Czech Republic.
profile_positions.description:
Research on structural engineering, particularly on concrete stochastic non-linear fracture mechanics. Some of my reponsibilities:
• Manage relationships between Spanish and Czech universities.
• Perform stochastic nonlinear FEM calculations. 
• Research stochastic nonlinear behavior of concrete fracture mechanics through Finite Element Modelling (FEM).
• Model the size effects in concrete specimens via computational stochastic fracture mechanics
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Intern - Researcher on structural engineering

profile_positions.description: Assist on several geotechnical consultancy projects on residential complexes. E.g. slope stability, retaining walls, differential settlements on buildings, among others.
profile_positions.title: Geotechnical consultant assistant

profile_positions.description:
Geotechnical characterization of soft soils using preload at the Port of Algeciras:

•  Design the preload ground improvement to decrease differential settlements in the infrastructure.
•  Study the delayed consolidation phenomenon in soft soils. 
•  Provide a geotechnical monitoring plan during and post preload.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor thesis intern - Geotechnical consultancy project

volunteer_experiences.description:
Design consultancy and construction works for people affected by the earthquake of September, 2017 and/or living at slums in Mexico. Some works:
•  Construction of temporary houses and offices.
•  Design consultancy for civil works such as non-potable and waste water systems or foundations of buildings.
